alert.note: Alert for Cass; Gage; Lancaster; Otoe; Saline; Sarpy; Saunders (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:27AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Sarpy, Lancaster, northwestern Otoe, northeastern Saline, southeastern Saunders, north central Gage and western Cass Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 827 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Ashland to near Walton to 3 miles northwest of Crete. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ashland, Greenwood, Walton and Holmes Lake Park around 830 AM CDT. Eagle around 835 AM CDT. Bennet and Murdock around 840 AM CDT. Louisville, Elmwood, Palmyra, Hallam and Sprague around 845 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Weeping Water, Cortland, Unadilla, Douglas, Syracuse, Firth and Avoca. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 407 and 428. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cass; Gage; Lancaster; Otoe; Saline; Sarpy; Saunders
